page.title: 01Ridge Commanding Nene Valley
page.content: Little Brington is a small village six miles west of Northampton. An old Roman road passes east to west through Nobottle and south of Little Brington along the ridge of hills to Daventry. The rural nature of the area, which is largely devoted to mixed farming, has been maintained because it has been part of the estate of Earl Spencer of Althorp since the 16th century. However, only a small minority if its population of 250 is now employed locally. Nobottle remains remains a hamlet of old stone houses but half of the houses in Little Brington have been built since 1945. Many residents are retired or commute to work in neighbouring towns. Prominent landmarks are the Electricity Board's Supergrid pylons which cross the area from north to south and the spire of St. John's
